definitions.definition: To grow roots ; to enter the earth, as roots ; to take root and begin to grow .
examples: The cuttings are starting to root .

definitions.definition: To prepare , oversee , or otherwise cause the rooting of cuttings .
examples: We rooted some cuttings last summer.

definitions.definition: ( computing slang , transitive ) To get root or privileged access on (a computer system or mobile phone ), often through bypassing some security mechanism.
examples: We rooted his box and planted a virus on it.
I want to root my Android phone so I can remove the preinstalled crapware.

main_definition: To grow roots ; to enter the earth, as roots ; to take root and begin to grow .
secondary_definitions: To prepare , oversee , or otherwise cause the rooting of cuttings .
( computing slang , transitive ) To get root or privileged access on (a computer system or mobile phone ), often through bypassing some security mechanism.

definitions.definition: ( ambitransitive ) To turn up or dig with the snout.
examples: A pig roots the earth for truffles.

definitions.definition: ( by extension ) To seek favour or advancement by low arts or grovelling servility; to fawn .
( intransitive ) To rummage ; to search as if by digging in soil .
examples: rooting about in a junk-filled drawer

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) Of a baby : to turn the head and open the mouth in search of food .
( transitive ) To root out ; to abolish .
( equestrianism , of a horse ) To tug or pull at the reins aggressively by driving the head downwards while wearing a bit .
( Australia , New Zealand , Ireland , vulgar , slang ) To sexually penetrate .

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To turn up or dig with the snout.
secondary_definitions: ( by extension ) To seek favour or advancement by low arts or grovelling servility; to fawn .
( intransitive ) To rummage ; to search as if by digging in soil .
( intransitive ) Of a baby : to turn the head and open the mouth in search of food .
( transitive ) To root out ; to abolish .
( equestrianism , of a horse ) To tug or pull at the reins aggressively by driving the head downwards while wearing a bit .

definitions.definition: To cheer (on); to show support (for) and hope for the success of. ( See root for . )
examples: I'm rooting for you, don't let me down!

main_definition: ( intransitive , with "for" or "on" , US ) To cheer (on); to show support (for) and hope for the success of. ( See root for . ) [late 19th century]
